Posts.Content: HI ..i just wanted to also say mammo's are for women 35 and older.. unless the patient has family history of breast cancer then the radioligist will speak to the refering physican.. but they uslally start with a breast sono because womens breast are very dense under 35. and the sono picks up things the mammo won't see in dense breasts. then after the sono is doe then the dr will decide if a mammo is ness. i work in radiology . i see this all the time with dr's sending patients for mammo's first. be well
Posts.Title: Im 23 - could i have breast cancer??
